wsknn.utils package¶

Submodules¶

wsknn.utils.calc module¶

wsknn.utils.calc.is_there_any_common_element(first: set, second: set) → int¶

The function checks if there are common elements in two sets and if there are any then it returns 1, else 0.

Parameters

  • first (set) – unique items from the set A

  • second (set) – unique items from the set B

Returns

True if there is any common element between sets A and B; 0 otherwise

Return type

bool

wsknn.utils.calc.weight_set_pair(first: set, second: set, mapped_items_weights: dict) → float¶
The function calculates weighted average of the common items from two sessions based on the dict with items and

their weights.

Parameters

  • first (set) – unique items from the set A

  • second (set) – unique items from the set B

  • mappped_items_weights (dict) – {item_id : weight}

Returns

Estimated weight between two item sets. Always 0 or positive.

Return type

float

wsknn.utils.errors module¶

exception wsknn.utils.errors.InvalidDimensionsError(set_type: str, expected_dimensions: Union[int, list])¶

Bases: Exception

The exception is raised when the dimension of the input session-items map or input item-sessions map is not valid.

set_type¶

Item-sessions map or session-items map.

Type

str

expected_dimensions¶
Type

int

exception wsknn.utils.errors.InvalidTimestampError(timestamp_sample)¶

Bases: Exception

The exception is raised when the timestamp is not a numeric value.

exception wsknn.utils.errors.TooShortSessionException(session_length: int, top_n: int)¶

Bases: Exception

The exception is raised by the Mean Reciprocal Rank metrics if session length is shorter than the number of top n recommendations.

wsknn.utils.errors.check_data_dimension(record: list, dimensions: int) → bool¶

The method checks if the dimension of a record is equal to the –dimensions– parameter.

Parameters

  • record (list) – Nested iterable.

  • dimensions (int) – Number of nested dimensions.

Returns

True - dimensions are equal to a number of the nested sequences. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

wsknn.utils.errors.check_numeric_type_instance(value) → bool¶

Method checks if value is int or float

Parameters

value (Expected Numeric type) –

Returns

True - value is numeric, False - value is other than the number

Return type

bool

wsknn.utils.meta.parse_settings(settings_file: str) → dict¶

The function parses settings file into dict

Parameters

Returns

ydict – Parsed settings used for modeling.

dict
